description: Retrieve a JPG-format screenshot of a running instance to help with troubleshooting.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: The GetConsoleScreenshot API call captures a screenshot of a running EC2 instance, providing a visual snapshot of the system's state. This can reveal sensitive information displayed on the screen, such as open applications, user activities, or visible credentials.

Accessing the GetConsoleScreenshot API requires valid credentials, indicating the need for authorized access to the instance. Unauthorized use of these credentials can lead to capturing sensitive information from the instance.
The screenshot can provide insights into user accounts and other details visible on the instance, aiding in account discovery.
The screenshot might reveal running processes or applications, helping in process discovery.

The contents of the screenshot retrieved via GetConsoleScreenshot may be deliberately altered or obscured by an attacker to avoid detection. This can make it harder to recognize malicious activity or sensitive data on the instance.
Screenshots may reveal network configurations displayed on the system's desktop.
Information visible in the screenshot might provide details about other systems or network topology.
If the screenshot shows login prompts or error messages related to login attempts, it can aid in brute force attempts.

incidents.description: Compromised Cloud Compute Credentials: Case Studies From the Wild

securityImplications: Attackers might use GetConsoleScreenshot to capture the current state of an EC2 instance's console, potentially revealing sensitive information displayed on the screen or identifying misconfigurations.
